metadata.title: CVE-2015-4489 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The nsTArray_Impl class in Mozilla Firefox before 40.0, Firefox ESR 38.xbefore 38.2, and Firefox OS before 2.2 might allow remote attackers tocause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecifiedother impact by leveraging a self assignment.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-4489` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '40.0+build4-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:38.2.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
